  • Christina Koch

Experience

  • I have facilitated meetings with researchers about large-scale computing techniques for research, math grad TA training, problem-solving workshops for high school students, a women's arts workshop and short lessons in dance.
  • I have taught two-day workshops of computing skills, a first-year calculus course at a major university, and courses in math and writing at the Adult Basic Education/General Education Development level.
  • I have written computing lesson material, software portability exercises, over 100 peer-reviewed solutions for a math learning resource, documentation for the resource, a curriculum for a GED math workshop, a graduate thesis in mathematics, 4 published papers, and a successful grant application (see my Portfolio).
  • I have coordinated volunteer mentoring efforts, an online learning resource and a catering team.
  • I have tutored high school math and science, SAT/ACT testing and university-level mathematics.

Skills

    Cognitive
  • Identifying patterns, connecting ideas, summarizing information
  • Leading discussions and meetings
  • Reading and assimilating new information quickly, writing with clarity
    • Educational
  • Designing curricula/lessons, preparing talks
  • Teaching and facilitating in both workshop-style and classroom settings
  • One-on-one tutoring
    • Computing
  • Proficient: Python, R, Git, Bash, HTCondor and DAGMan, HTML/CSS, Wordpress, Mac/Windows/Linux
  • Intermediate: SLURM, MediaWiki, Latex, SQL, Jekyll
